review.title: Automatic Extraction of Protein Interaction in Literature
review.abstract: Protein-protein interaction extraction is the key precondition of the construction of protein knowledge network, and it is very important for the research in the biomedicine. This paper extracted directional protein-protein interaction from the biological text, using the SVM-based method. Experiments were evaluated on the LLL05 corpus with good results. The results show that dependency features are import for the protein-protein interaction extraction and features related to the interaction word are effective for the interaction direction judgment. At last, we analyzed the effects of different features and planed for the next step.
histories: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to its lack of academic value

metadata.title: Automatic Extraction of Protein-Protein Interaction in Literature

sections.text: This paper extracted the directional protein-protein interaction from the biological text using the SVM-based method. Experiments were evaluated on the LLL05 corpus with good results, showing that dependency traits are important for protein-protein interaction and traits related to the interaction word are effective for the direction of interaction. Finally, we analyzed the effects of various traits and planned for the next step. Keywords: support vector machines (SVM), bio-entity relation, protein-protein interaction, entity relation direction.

sections.heading: 1 Introduction
sections.text: With the rapid development of life sciences, biomedical literature has grown very rapidly, and information extraction technology has already established itself. As a result, research in biomedical information extraction is becoming increasingly important, and relationship extraction is one of the most important. It is not only practical, but it is also the foundation of the relationship database and biological knowledge network, and it also plays a key role in predicting therelations and drug production. Now, relationship extraction has already become a hotspot, but there are also some problems. For example, the result is not good enough, and some important information such as direction and type are ignored. This paper has researched two aspects: improving the outcome and more accurate representation of more information about relationships, for example direction. In the direction of the characters of biomedical literature, we have designed some new features and extracted relationships with the good machine learning model SVM, and the experiments have shown that the results were good.

sections.heading: 2 Extracting Protein-Protein Interaction
sections.text: It is not the first time that the EU Commission has taken such a step.

sections.heading: 2.1 Problem definition
sections.text: If two protein names and an interaction word occur simultaneously in a sentence, we can transmit the mission by concluding that there is a PPI between the two proteins. First, the sentences were filtered by the simple rule that two protein names occur side by side in a sentence. Second, we used a trained SVM model to solve this classification problem. After relation extraction, we decided on the direction of the relationship as it is important for building a biological network.

sections.heading: 2.2 Feature design
sections.text: The basis of the basic features consisted of context features, sub-tree features and sentence features, each feature being designed for different situations.Tab.1 Basic information of logical features Meaning (1) Distance # of words between two proteins (2) proNumBT # of proteins between two proteins (3) VerbBT Whether the verb between (4) puncNum # of punctuation between two proteins exists Tab.2 Basic information of dependence Features Meaning (1) P1DW The word protein 1 depends on dependence (2) DT1 The word protein 1 depends on s (3) puncNum # of punctuation between two proteins Tab.2 Basic information of dependence Features Meanings instance (1) P1DW The word protein 1 depends on dependence (3) P1DW protein (4) The word proteins depend on two (2) WOS proteins WOS clause 1 The WOS clause 1 The WOS clause 1 The WOS clause 1 The word protein 1W (2) The WOS clause 1 The WOS clause 1W (2) The basic features (1) The basic features (1) WOS protein WOS clause 1 WOS clause 1 The WOS 1 WOS 1

sections.heading: 3 Experiment
sections.text: It is not the first time that the EU Commission has taken such a step.

sections.heading: 3.1 Corpus and preprocessing
sections.text: We use the standard corpus LLL05 corpus (J. Hakenberg, et al., 2005). First, we have to recognize the protein names in each sentence; the sentence contains two protein names that are selected by the text pre-process described in Section 2.1; and the final statistics of the protein name that recognizes the result are presented in Table 4.And the corpus is separated as T1, T2, and T3 according to the ratio of 2: 1: 1. T1 is used as a training set; T2 for parameter modulation; T3 for the test.

sections.heading: 3.2 Results
sections.text: In this experiment, we obtained 38,504 proteins and 51,568 PPIs between them by the SVM-based method. SVM-based Medel achieved a good preference of 82.4% precision, 73.7% recall and 77.8% F-score. Experiments on the LL05 corpus showed that the F-value was as high as 80% and the new features improved the results. In the conclusion, the syntactic features improved both the precision and the logical features.
